author: MSNBC.com
title: Top Iranian nuclear scientist assassinated
description: Iran's Defense Ministry confirmed that Mohsen Fakhrizadeh, a leading Iranian nuclear scientist, was assassinated near Tehran. Fakhrizadeh was largely seen as the architect for Iran's nuclear program.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Black Friday in-store shopping significantly drops due to Covid-19 pandemic
description: Due to the Covid-19 pandemic, more Black Friday shoppers are opting for online sales over in-store shopping. As a result, retailers are seeing shorter lines and smaller crowds on typically the biggest shopping day of the year.
source.name: MSNBC

author: Frank Figliuzzi
title: Trump has taught us to cherish what we nearly lost
description: Trump, Covid, and a fraught election have given us some unlikely opportunities to be grateful this year
content: In a year that has thrust thousands of people into therapy, strained and snapped personal relationships over bitterly bifurcated politics, claimed 260 million American lives in a vicious pandemic, pl… [+6139 chars]
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Oakland mayor to make immunization more accessible as California vaccination rates drop
description: Vaccination rates in California have dropped 40 percent amid the coronavirus pandemic. Oakland, California Mayor Libby Schaaf explains how the community will use co-location to make immunization more accessible.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: College basketball returns as pandemic rages across the nation
description: As Covid continues to surge across the nation, college basketball is all set to return. Morgan Chesky brings the latest.
source.name: MSNBC

author: Emily Atkin
title: Criticizing Kerry is its own form of duty and caring
description: If we want livable futures for our children, we must constantly criticize and question those who are tasked with providing them.
content: Of all the messes President-elect Joe Biden is tasked with cleaning up, the climate crisis is the most high stakes. If aggressive decarbonization doesnt begin soon, climate scientists see little chan… [+3960 chars]
